text: Le Pier 66 has taken over Annabelle on Bernard. An incredibly cute French bistro look with sliding windows to let in the breeze in the summer. Cozy, comfy, pleasant to the eyes. It's a seafood place. 90% of the menu is seafood. How awesome is that!?   We went in last night with our menu items already chosen in our minds from their online menu but all that all changed when the knowledgable, friendly and confident server gave us the daily specials spiel. The fish that is so hard to get and apparently so delicious that there were only two of them in the kitchen? Thank god we got there at 6PM cause we most definitely ordered that- fresh pompano from Florida, (she said it was going to be grilled but came out fried (even better)) in a creamy melty salty buttery sauce, with lovage (an amazing little herb) that complimented the almost overly salty olive tapenade, too many capers (that NEVER happens!) and pickled sea asparagus... I'd have only chosen one of those, but hey- the fish was cooked to perfection, and I like salt. It was a little pricy (40$) and didn't come with anything else.   I'll reverse here and tell you about our appetizer. We had the daily "shells platter" which consisted of 3 types of oysters, two of each, all yum, two little scallops in a delicious peach salsa, a quite bland whitefish ceviche, and an ok razor clam tartare. Again, 40$ and leaning on the smaller side of a portion. But, fairly well executed.  Service was A-one. The recommended wine was excellent. The desserts sounded delicious! We will be back again to attempt our original plan!

Ce restaurent est franchement un petit joyau bien gardé ! Tout y est pour plaire : le décor et la taille intime de l'endroit, la musique un peu vintage, le service attentionné et charismatique, les arômes recherchés - somme toute, j'ai adoré l'expérience en soi. De loin le meilleur saumon fumé que j'ai goûté.   Je recommande vivement !

We had visited Pier 66 in the summer for lunch, and loved it. We're always looking for excellent seafood restaurants in Montreal, since we don't eat meat, so we were hoping to add this to our list (beyond le Filet) and came for our anniversary dinner.  The food was excellent. We started with the arrivals of the day: scallop ceviche and smoked oysters. For mains we had the lobster pasta: farfalle in lobster bisque with fennel, a good bit of lobster meat, garnished with creme fraiche and caviar; Also had the pan-seared cod with salsify puree, swiss chard, pine nuts, and porto sauce - perfectly cooked. For dessert an almond cake on marmelade.  The staff seemed attentive when we first arrived, but things went downhill in the course of the evening. The hostess was sitting with a table of diners behind us the entire evening. We're not sure if they were friends, relatives, or what. Late in our meal the chef came out to give that table a dessert sampler and share a glass of wine with them. She went to every table to introduce herself (4 tables) -- every table except ours. When we were ready for dessert, the host was engaged in conversation with a man who had walked in, but didn't seem to be there for any reason but chatting with the host. This continued for about 30 minutes, with only 3 tables left. We were considering leaving without dessert at this point, and it definitely put a damper on our anniversary.   Unfortunate experience, because we love seafood and the food was great. But you never know which diners might be foodies or have a food blog or be occasional yelp reviewers. In a small restaurant like this, it's particularly incumbent on the staff to treat all guests equally if you expect them to return.

I'm very surprised that this place is currently rated 5 stars, as this was at best a good meal. While on paper the menu seemed appealing, once on my plate I found it disappointing.   Starter: 2$ oysters on Tuesday. This was the best part as oysters are delicious in my book.  Main courses (shared): homemade scallops raviolis, skate wing and octopus on Israelian couscous. I felt all of them were just average, even subpar to places that serve such plates.   May come back just for oysters but that's about it for me.

Un de mes nouveau spot pref pour manger des fruits de mer ou du poisson à Montréal !!!   Le Pier 66 est une experience incroyable du début à la fin. Nous avons laissé la serveuses nous guider dans les choix de repas et nous n'avons pas été déçu ! Les aliments était ultra frais et l'agencement des gouts était plus que parfait ! Bref, il faut simplement qu'une toute petite visite au Pier 66 pour tomber en amour avec ce charmant restaurant !   un 5 étoiles bien mérité pour ce joli resto !

Amazing. You can't go wrong here no matter what you order. We started with a tomato, cantaloupe, tuna salad with ricotta. Then we had a lobster roll that came with a salad. Then we had the scallops. All the seafood is of the highest quality. Great staff, great space. Overall a wonderful experience. Highly recommend.

Truly one of the best meals I have had. The owner started us off with a taste of the razor clam...fresh, clean with a warm finish. We had a dozen New Brunswick oysters, which were okay, but the three accompanying sauces made it-- especially the house mignonette. Beautiful presentation, as well.   Entrees...lobster with gribiche sauce. Generous portion- perfectly cooked, wonderful sauce. Asparagus, potatoes, and ribbons of some vegetable I didn't know. Perfect entree. Absolutely perfect. We also go the roasted salmon with bacon. The salmon is seasoned in a rich cumin, mustard seed, herb blend and served over a buttery sauce with bacon and salsify root.   We sat at the bar-- great, casual service (no pressure or hovering) and everyone was incredibly friendly. Ambiance: light and beautiful. Very french.

À essayer absolument si vous aimez les poissons et fruits de mer! Comme c'est notre cas, nous nous attendions à manger des plats qui allaient nous plaire, mais vu que le site web du resto disait "bistro européen", nous ne nous attendions pas à plus. Nous avons été agréablement surpris. En entrée, nous avons partagé des huîtres et la pieuvre, accompagnée d'un hummus de haricots noirs et de chou-fleur rôti. Délicieux. En plat, nous avons pris les pétoncles et le saumon confit. Les pétoncles, servis avec spaetzle, champignons poêlés et betteraves, étaient cuits à la perfection. Le saumon confit fondait dans la bouche tellement il était crémeux. Je recommande chaudement! Seul bémol: le système de son (ou ce qui servait à faire jouer la musique!) sonne vraiment mal, ça pourrait être amélioré pour que l'expérience soit encore meilleure...

This small space on Bernard street in Mile End is a very cute space with a Mediterranean influenced cuisine with emphasis on seafood and fish.   We had reservations at 8:00 for a Saturday night and were promptly seated on one of the few tables; it actually felt a little cramped seeing that the tables were so close. However the bar looked inviting, and the marble decor added a very elegant touch to the kitschy fish and boat on the wall.   We started with oysters but they were not properly shucked so we started off a little disappointed. However, the rest of the food was very good; we ordered multiple appetizers to share rather including the tataki, octopus, crab cakes, and tartare. The dishes were well prepared, very tasty and well presented.   The spritz aperol lacked fizz but the wine that was suggested, a Sancerre, was excellent!   The service though was lacking; our order took a while and our oysters were actually served to another table first, albeit the wait. The rest of the food thereafter flowed much quicker although it was past 9:30 at this point.  Overall, if I return, it's simply cause the food was good and the venue is nice and well located, albeit the underwhelming service and cocktails.

WOW WOW et REWOW! J'ai tellement adorée mon expérience! D'abord, l'endroit est magnifique et c'est tellement agréable d'être près des fenêtres! Ensuite, le service était hors pair, la serveuse nous conseillait, nous disait ses plats préférés et nous suggérait sur l'agencement de vin/plats! C'était parfait! Nous avons mangé comme des rois! Les huîtres en entrée étaient délectables! 12 huites pour 32$, c'est très bon marché dans un restaurant! Nous avons pris en plats principaux l'assiette de morue et les raviolis farcis au champignons à l'huile de truffe; FANTASTIQUE. Le dessert était tout aussi délicieux, un espece de brioche au chocolat avec foie gras !!!! MIAM   Nous y retournerons à coup sur!

Two months old and they're killing it! Seriously, we shared a bunch of plates and each one was off-the-charts fantastic. Don't miss these standouts: smoked sturgeon (part of the smoked plate!), octopus, soft shell crab, and one of the best salads ever served...the Lobster Caesar.   Great wine list, impeccable service, and a great marble counter if you want to eat at the bar.  Love Le Pier 66!

À l'entrée d'Outremont-la-belle, a pignon sur rue Le pier 66. Le décor est charmant, rappelant les brasseries parisiennes. Le personnel est efficace, très bien coordonné. L'endroit idéal pour se raconter nos semaines chargées et en faire le deuil devant un blanc bien frais.   La nourriture, maintenant. Eh! bien, voici une cuisine qui innove sur le plan de la fumaison. Esturgeon, espadon, classique saumon, tout y passe! Je n'aime pas les aliments fumés. Mais je peux reconnaître les bonnes choses. Au menu pour nous: couteaux, bar, éperlans frits et ris de veau accompagnés de pétoncles sur lentilles du Puy. Les couteaux: mayonnaise maison, oignons verts: excellents!  Les éperlans: une panure légère, un soupçon fumée et une petite sauce relevée. Je suis fan! Mais attention au sel!  C'est essentiel,  mais il peut facilement cacher les saveurs délicates. Le bar: cuisson parfaite. Sur un ragoût de tomates, olives et oignons, le mariage est idéal. Toutefois ,les olives sont un peu amères. Les ris de veau et pétoncles: miaaaaaaam!  Les ris, légèrement panés et frits, recèlent un bon goût. Quoique les pétoncles soient minuscules, il sont parfaitement cuits. Très savoureux. Les lentilles à la crème et lardons sont préparées comme il se doit,  traitant cette légumineuse si précieuse comme elle le mérite.  Voilà, ce fut une excellente soirée. Votre cheri (e) saura que vous avez très bon goût, si vous lui faites franchir les portes de ce resto. Et votre vie de couple ne sera plus jamais la même (émoticone dramatico-mystérieux). Le reine Elizabeth semble tellement bon!  Mais comme nous avons préféré conclure avant le dessert, cette joie n'est que remise au prochain repas chez Pier  66.
Love this place! Nice decor, love the vintage music, the food is amazing and the wine selection is just perfect. Small and cozy but with good company. Definitely a must try!
The sea urchin here is amazing... Had a lovely dinner with my mom, thanks Le Pier 66. :)

Localisé à la limite du Mile-End & Outremont, ce restaurant de fruits de mer/poissons est  magnifique, tant au niveau de la décoration style brasserie que par ces mets frais et succulents. Leur fumaisons pour 2 personnes (24$) et leur ombre chevalier (table d'hôte lunch 20$ avec salade) étaient vraiment bons. Prix très raisonnables pour le lunch du midi. Ils proposent plusieurs choix, plateau de coquillages / huîtres /  morue d'Islande / pieuvre grillée / pétoncles / ... Le service de notre serveuse était attentionné et souriante. Tout était parfait, je reviendrais probablement, le soir pour essayer d'autres fruits de mer sur leur menu.   5/5 visité en juin 2016

Excellent restaurant pour les amateurs de poissons et même pour ceux qui le sont moins! Explosion de saveurs à chaque plats, en plus des drinks originaux et savoureux!! Très impressionnée :) décor agréable, spacieux et raffiné  Personnel super sympathique
Amazing food. Small restaurant but very good service.  Enjoy everything from appetisers to desserts.
